How can I prepare my smartphone to mine VerusCoin, and what steps do I need to take to set up a mining environment on my Android device?

To mine VerusCoin on your smartphone, you'll need to follow a few steps to prepare your device. First, you'll need to get a VerusCoin wallet and create a mining address. You can choose from multiple VerusCoin wallets, including the Verus Desktop wallet for Windows, MacOS, and Linux, or the iOS/Android mobile wallet, paper wallet, or other alternate wallets.

Next, you'll need to install Termux, an Android terminal emulator and Linux environment application that works directly with no rooting or setup required. You can download Termux from the Google Play Store or F-Droid.

Once you have Termux installed, you'll need to check your CPU for AES instructions and ensure that it's an ARMV8 version. You can do this by running the `lscpu` command and searching for `aes`, `pmull`, and `armv8/aarch64`.

After that, you'll need to install the `proot` package, which allows you to run Linux distributions inside Termux without having to root your device. You can install `proot` by running the command `pkg install proot`.

Finally, you can use `proot-distro` to install a Linux distribution inside Termux, which will allow you to set up a mining environment on your Android device. This will require some technical knowledge and expertise, but with the right tools and steps, you can successfully mine VerusCoin on your smartphone.

Note that mining VerusCoin on a smartphone may not be as efficient as mining on a dedicated computer, but it's still possible to do so with the right setup and configuration.

Title: Mining VerusCoin On Smartphone
Article URL: https://medium.com/veruscoin/mining-veruscoin-on-smartphone-208dbb06905f
Content:Mining VerusCoin On a SmartphoneModern cell phones (Octa-Core) are more powerful than computers over eleven years old (Pentium 4) when the advent of bitcoin shook the world.
The only hardware required, in the beginning, was a simple computer… Things have changed a lot in less than 11 years.
So let’s start preparing our Smartphone to mine VerusCoin, we will need to do some steps before.
Get a VerusCoin Wallet.
chose one of the multiple VerusCoin Wallets To creat Your Mining address
You’ll need a VerusCoin address, which you can create using one of the multiple wallets listed on the VerusCoin Website. Verus Desktop is recommended for Windows/MacOS/Linux, or use the iOS/Android mobile wallet , paper Wallet or other alternate wallets.
Linux Command Line on Android With Termux.
Install termux
from: GooglePlayStore or F-Droid
>Termux is an Android terminal emulator and Linux environment application that works directly with no rooting or setup required. Termux provides a package ecosystem similar to the one in Linux distributions. However you should be aware that Termux is just a regular application running on Android OS. summarizing Termux to a terminal is very reductive
We’ll use only Termux for the rest of this tutorial.
Check you cpu For AES instructions and also the Architecture We need ARMV8 version
run “ lscpu ” and search for aes, pmull, and armv8/aarch64Install Proot pkg : ‘pkg install proot’
>The main purpose of PRoot is to run the Linux distributions inside Termux without having to root the device.
Proot
Installing Linux distributions
Termux provides a package `proot-distro`, which allows us to install Linux on a chrooted environment.
proot-distro takes care of management of the Linux distributions inside Termux ,Install this utility
